results.title: The Woodwind choir
results.brief_description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. Compositions by Brahms, Mendelssohn, Rossini, von Weber, Beethoven, and Schumann are used to demonstrate the function of woodwind instruments in full orchestral setting.

results.title: Wood joints
results.creator_credit: Joe Jayward, James McCormick and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Precise camerawork shows clearly how the end butt joint is made, how to make a rabbet joint, how a dado joint is formed, and the difference between the dado joint and the groove joint. Also demonstrates the technique of using dowels to add strength to a joint and how to make a lap joint.

results.title: Wonder birds of Australia
results.creator_credit: Harold J. Pollock and Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Studies the unique characteristics of Australian birds including distinctive bird calls, flight sequences and the variety of parrots and honeyeaters. Illustrates the unique behaviour of the cassowary, bower bird, mallee fowl, scrub turkey and the lyrebird. Narrated by John Dease.

results.title: The Women's Royal Australian Army Corps
results.creator_credit: Central Video Film Service Australian Army Public Relations
results.brief_description: The life and work of servicewomen in the WRAAC shows them as signal and survey corps personnel, as drivers, storeswomen and caterers, and in a variety of office jobs. Many courses are available through which they may become officers. The type of accommodation provided and after-hours recreations available.

results.title: Equality and development
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Mark Robbins, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made during International Women’s Year, 1975, this film is about an International Women’s Forum discussing equal rights for women. In Tunisia, small changes have begun, but more is needed. Women need more education, and employment opportunities; to eradicate illiteracy and teach family planning. The cities and amusements belong to the men - this is to be changed.

results.title: A Woman's place is...
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
This film was made during the International Women’s Year, 1975 and focuses on Sweden as an example of committed government using the full range of tools at its disposal in a real attempt to give substance to equality for women as set down in the United Nations Charter. Discusses women’s role in the workforce, sexism in the advertising world, men’s role in parenting and sharing house duties, educating primary aged children about gender roles and stereotyping, and basically highlighting the need for equality in all areas of life. Narrated by Joyce Gordon.

results.title: Women in sports an informal history
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zitrin, Dan Klugherz and Altana Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the participation of women in sports from classical times to the present day. Discusses prejudice against the physically active woman, the growing awareness of women’s rights as sports participants, and the new enthusiasm of women for sports. Incorporates archival footage and drawings and features famous sportswomen including, Sonja Henie, Margaret Smith-Court, and Billie Jean King.

results.title: With gentle majesty
results.brief_description: This film recalls the hey-day of the working horse at the turn of the century, and reflects on the decreasing number used today. The title is from Shakespeare’s lines: “Sometimes he trots, as if he told the steps, with gentle majesty and modest pride”. Narrated by Wynn Roberts. (Award: AFI Silver Award)

results.title: Witch doctor
results.brief_description: Choreographic interpretation of voodoo ritual performed by Haitian witch doctor, danced by Jean Leon Destine, to rid a woman possessed of an eil spirit. Accompanied by music of drums.
